name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @HouseDems These bills would work in tandem, with the Freedom to Vote Act responding to current threats to our democracy, and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act preventing states from enacting discriminatory voting laws going forward. I urge the Senate to pass both bills.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This bill, which @HouseDems passed, would prevent states from enacting laws which are designed to make it harder to vote for people of color. It is time for the Senate to advance H.R. 4 to restore protections for the right to vote.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The John R. Lewis Voting Advancement Rights Act restores the requirement that states with a history of racial discrimination in voting receive approval from the DOJ in order to make changes to voting systems.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Freedom to Vote Act includes similar provisions to H.R. 1, the For the People Act, which I cosponsored and voted for when it passed the House in March 2021. Unfortunately, this important voting rights legislation has stalled in the Senate.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text:
The Freedom to Vote Act, led by @SenAmyKlobuchar, sets nationwide standards to protect American‚Äôs vote. It would:
‚úÖExpand automatic voter registration
‚úÖMake Election Day a holiday
‚úÖStrengthen vote-by-mail and early voting
‚úÖPrevent election subversion 
‚úÖ& other reforms

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The anniversary of Jan. 6 reminds us of the danger that our democracy faces and its vulnerability to election subversion. It is time to pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Act to protect our democracy and the sacred right to vote.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: My staff and I would like to thank everyone who has reached out with concerns for our safety and wellbeing. January 6th was horrific on multiple levels as we watched barricades fall to an attack on our democracy and the place where we work for the 8th District of New Jersey.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: For his actions, I have voted to impeach President Trump for a second time. He must be held accountable for the damage he has done to our nation.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: He refused to disavow white supremacy and right-wing hate groups, instead telling them to stand by. Immediately before the traumatic events of January 6th, he actively incited violence, whipped up hatred, and directed a mob to the Capitol.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: None of this had to happen. President Trump could have put the nation, and our democratic institutions, over his own pride and greed. He chose not to. Instead of accepting the possibility of losing a second term, he preemptively chipped away at faith in our electoral system.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I saw an armed standoff as officers barred doors with shattered windows to give people on the Floor time to get out. I saw members helping each other put on escape hoods because gas had been deployed in the Rotunda. I saw Capitol police crushed under a mob of hatred and vitriol.

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I could feel the vibrations as the mob pounded on the doors and walls of the House Chamber, screaming for the heads of those who sought to uphold the rule of law. I saw things I never in a million years would have expected to see in the Capitol.

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Since I first came to Congress I have continually fought for necessary funding to update infrastructure like the Portal Bridge. I am glad to see these funds disbursed that will help secure the Portal Bridge while keeping our infrastructure and economy moving.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This funding will allow for appropriate changes that will ensure the full operation of the Portal Bridge.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This century-old bridge has desperately needed funding for years. Although a crucial piece of infrastructure for the Northeast, the bridge sometimes has to be locked into place by workers with sledgehammers.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Portal Bridge is essential in connecting the entire northeast corridor from Boston to Washington D.C. The bridge carries an average of 450 trains and 200,000 passengers each day, and is essential for moving the economy of NJ and the entire Northeast.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Federal Railroad Administration just announced $91.5 million in funding to help advance the replacement of the Portal North Bridge and to make upgrades along the Amtrak Northeast Corridor (NEC). https://t.co/u6QCEcTapM

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act seeks to address the challenges so many are struggling with by supporting programs for workers, the unemployed, renters, small businesses, health care systems, and more.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @MyLifeIsMunitz @RepTimRyan @RoKhanna @RepJayapal @RashidaTlaib Hey Jon, I've been pushing for recurring payments like the ones included in Chairwoman Waters' plan from March and last week I cosponsored H.R. 6496, the Emergency Money for the People Act https://t.co/lE00FolXpj

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would also authorize $5 bil for schools & libraries to provide internet services for students & teachers by providing laptops, wi-fi hotspots, & more, would provide student debt relief & puts in place a temporary suspension of payments for all federal student loan borrowers.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This funding is flexible and can be used to address the unique needs of different communities and can support purchasing technology, providing counseling and mental health services for students and staff, and authorized activities under IDEA and ESEA.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: COVID-19 has driven home that our school systems are not equal and that not everyone has the ability to carry on their education remotely. The Heroes Act begins to address this disparity by providing $90 billion for a State Fiscal Stabilization Fund.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Last but certainly not least, here are some of the education provisions in the Heroes Act: https://t.co/ajMGXeo0u5

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act would provide $500 billion directly to state governments and $375 billion for local governments so that we can protect those on the frontlines and ensure that the virus does not decimate public services.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: New Jersey has been hit hard by COVID-19 and our local governments are in desperate need of assistance to pay vital workers such as health care workers, police, firefighters, transportation workers, EMS, and teachers.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would strengthen the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) to ensure that underserved communities are not overlooked & improves PPP forgiveness by extending covered period. It would provide another $10 billion for EIDL grants including cash advances that don't need to be paid back

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Our neighborhood mom and pop shops are the backbone of our communities and the economic toll of COVID-19 is putting many of them at risk. The Heroes Act would build upon the programs put in place in previous stimulus packages to help small businesses ride out the storm.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We are still debating the Heroes Act so let's review some provisions for small businesses, states, and municipalities: https://t.co/ajMGXeo0u5

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $7 billion would be set aside for Child Care and Development Block Grants and another $850 million would go to the Social Services Block Grant to fund child and family care for essential workers.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Also included is emergency funding for school meal programs and the Child and Adult Care Food Program as well as support for services such as home-delivered meals.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act would boost SNAP benefits, providing $10 billion for the program, as well as an addition $150 million for The Emergency Food Assistance Program (TEFAP) to help local food banks meet the dramatically increased need.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would also dedicate $4 billion to public housing agencies to respond to the coronavirus and protect the 2.2 million families in current housing and any families newly impacted by the pandemic, including those fleeing domestic violence.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would extend the eviction and foreclosure moratorium that was created in the CARES Act, including all renters and homeowners.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would also create a $75 billion Homeowner Assistance Fund to help cover mortgage payments, property taxes, insurance, utilities, and other costs.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act would create a $100 billion Emergency Rental Assistance Program that will help renters cover the costs of their utility bills and rent.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The House is in the process of debating the Heroes Act so next I'll go over housing, nutritional, and child provisions: https://t.co/ajMGXeFBlD

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I am also pleased that these stimulus payments would be extended to Individual Taxpayer ID Number (ITIN) holders ‚Äì a massive oversight in previous stimulus packages that left out so many who contribute so much to our economy and society.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: While I still believe that we need recurring payments to ensure the financial security of families across the country I am pleased that families making less than $150,000 and individuals making less than $75,000 per year will get some assistance.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This is more than the stimulus payments in the CARES Act which was $1,200 per adult and $500 per child. Each eligible family will be able to receive up to $6,000.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This bill does not include recurring payments to individuals which I have been pushing for and will continue to push for. However, it does include another round of stimulus payments of $1,200 per family member.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $2 billion is set aside for worker training, and almost $1 billion is dedicated to helping process unemployment claims, funding that is much needed as states deal with record levels of claims.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would also extend the $600 a week, supplemental federal unemployment payments through January 31, 2020 ‚Äì providing some financial relief during this time of uncertainty.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act includes strong workplace standards and would require OSHA to issue strong, enforceable standards for infection control and prohibits employers from retaliating against workers who report infection control issues.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Next up, provisions that cover workers, the unemployed, and individuals:

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act would provide an additional $100 billion for supporting hospitals and frontline care providers and strengthen Medicaid programs across the country.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: New Jerseyans know just how devastating this virus is. We have lost so many of our friends, family, neighbors, and colleagues. Those who have gotten sick shouldn't have to worry about the $ of treatment which is why the Heroes Act ensures that every ppl can access free treatment.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We need a national strategy on testing with a clear timeline. The Heroes Act requires the Administration to submit such a plan to Congress by June 15th so that we can move forward as a nation in our fight against COVID-19.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It would also allocate an additional $75 billion for testing, contact tracing, and isolation measures. We won‚Äôt know the true scale of the health crisis until we have universal testing and to achieve that states and localities will need federal assistance.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Heroes Act would establish a $200 billion Heroes‚Äô Fund to provide hazard pay to the essential workers who are risking their lives each day during the pandemic.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: While it is not perfect, the bill includes hundreds of provisions that will provide relief, so I‚Äôll be highlighting some of them throughout the day. First up are provisions for health care workers, systems, and our response to COVID-19:

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Today, the House of Representatives is considering a 5th stimulus package in response to the COVID-19 pandemic ‚Äì the Heroes Act. It is comprehensive, addressing the needs of numerous communities including those who have not received the relief they need in previous packages.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Legislating is often a long and frustrating process but my Democratic colleagues and I will continue working on behalf of the American people. It is no accident that this year's NDAA is progressive, and I'll keep working in Congress to advance our priorities through legislation.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The resolution is called H.Con.Res.83, and it directs the President to terminate the use of America‚Äôs Armed Forces engaged in hostilities in or against Iran. Just as I supported the NDAA provision, I voted for this important resolution.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: For example, although the House-passed NDAA included a provision I voted for prohibiting unauthorized war with Iran, the final version of the bill did not. But yesterday, the House voted on a similar War Powers resolution regarding the issue.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Legislating is a process of negotiation and compromise, so not every position we want will be included in a final bill. But our system is designed to allow legislative efforts to evolve ‚Äì just because a policy isn‚Äôt in one bill doesn‚Äôt mean its doomed.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Legislating is a process of negotiation and compromise, so not every position we want will be included in a final bill. But our system is designed to allow legislative efforts to evolve ‚Äì just because a policy isn‚Äôt in one bill doesn‚Äôt mean its doomed.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: And this NDAA authorizes millions of dollars for military climate readiness and resiliency projects, directs DOD to plan for current climate-change vulnerabilities on our mil bases, and authorizes funding for military clean-energy research projects.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The bill also bans the use of PFAS forever-chemicals in firefighting agents used on military bases and in the packaging used for servicemembers‚Äô field meals, known as MREs. This is an important step forward in limiting the exposure of PFAS chems in our food and water supplies.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: And it repeals the ‚ÄúWidow‚Äôs Tax,‚Äù which is what happens when a fallen servicemember‚Äôs surviving spouse ‚Äì who is entitled to two gov. annuity payments ‚Äì has one payment reduced dollar-for-dollar by the other. Surviving spouses depend on these payments. I‚Äôm proud to vote to fix it.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: For example ‚Äì and for the first time ever ‚Äì this year‚Äôs NDAA implements 12 weeks of paid parental leave for all federal employees. This leave policy includes leave for birth, adoption, or fostering.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: But this year‚Äôs NDAA is among the most progressive ever enacted thanks to House Democrats prioritizing medical, family leave, environmental, and health provisions.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The NDAA is a massive bill (this year‚Äôs was over 1,000 pages long) that includes authorization and funding-level agreements for nearly every program run by the Department of Defense (DOD) ‚Äì this includes servicemember pay, funding for arms upgrades, and so on.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Each year, Congress gets together to debate which national defense programs to reauthorize and which ones to reel in. This is done through a legislative vehicle known as the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA).

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I have also sponsored H.R. 5221, and H.R. 3068, two more bills focused on mitigating the effects of climate change. If we want our planet to be enjoyed by our children and all the species that inhabit the earth, we must do more today to fight against climate change.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Although the Trump administration has pulled out of the Paris Climate Agreements and rebuked climate change, I have cosponsored H.R. 9, the Climate Action Now Act, which would direct the President to create a plan to adhere to the regulations in the Paris Climate Agreement.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Unfortunately, climate change is contributing to the further threat of extinction for multiple species. Climate change is on track to destroy many habitats leading to forced migration for numerous species, which will cause some of them to go extinct.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: While this list is long, the bills we passed included funding for hundreds of programs and provisions that will benefit communities across the country.  For more information visit the House Appropriations Committee website for a summary https://t.co/iEqoMZLnqN

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The package also provides $4 billion for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), almost $400 million more than the President‚Äôs requested budget. This funding is crucial to ensuring that Medicare and Medicaid programs are responsive and effective.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $944 million is also included to improve maternal and child health and reduce maternal mortality and $286 million in funding set aside for the Title X Family Planning program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This funding will go to crucial mental health resources for children and youth, substance abuse treatment and prevention, as well as increased funding for suicide lifeline and prevention efforts.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The inclusion of $10 million for a suicide prevention program is a step in the right direction for this nation to address mental health issues, which also benefits from the $5.9 billion for the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA).

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Within the $8 billion significant increases for major public health efforts are included such as $10 million for the establishment of a suicide prevention program, $230 million to address tobacco & e-cigarettes, and $173.4 million for global disease detection efforts.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Specifically, the package includes $2.8 billion for Alzheimer‚Äôs research, $3.1 billion for HIV/AIDS research, $195 million for the Cancer Moonshot initiative, and $200 million for research to develop a universal flu vaccine, just to name a few.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We increased funding for the National Institutes of Health by $2.6 billion from last year so that we can pursue innovative treatments and cures to help Americans suffering from a variety of health issues.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In this minibus a substantial amount of funding was granted to many health programs that I care deeply about. The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) was provided a total of $94.9 billion in funding, $4.4 billion more than in 2019.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: And the bill prohibits DOT from playing political games with the funding. Congress is ordering that DOT use these funds to help infrastructure projects that are ready to go and serve an important regional and national need. This includes the Gateway Project.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It includes provisions that DOT must consider transportation infrastructure projects fairly, as quickly as possible, and must provide project applicants with enough advance notice to give everyone time to prepare their project application.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The bill funds grants that finance State of Good Repair projects at $200m, rail infrastructure and safety grants at $325m, and grants to Amtrak's Northeast Corridor at $700m. It also provides nearly $2b for grants that finance new transportation infrastructure.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The $86.2b for the Department of Transportation (DOT), and the provisions included in the bill, are important steps forward for the Gateway Project and replacing the aging tunnels that connect our district to New York.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: While we need more than what is included in these bills, the money provided is a good baseline for us to build upon.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: As a member of the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, I know how desperately we need funding to fix our deteriorating roads, bridges, tunnels, and rail lines.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This money will go toward the medical services that the VA provides former servicemembers, finances upgrades to the VA's health records systems, and provides $125m to address the veterans' disability claims backlog.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In addition to assisting veterans transition to civilian life, these bills finance our nation's veterans' care programs and military construction projects. It finances the building of new military family housing at $1.3b and provides $216.5b for the Dept of Veterans' Affairs (VA)

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: ...$55m for the Homeless Vets Reintegration Program, $29m for Transition Assistance, and $300k to establish Disabled Veteran Program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Funding was also allocated to programs that assist our veterans who need help reintegrating after service with $311m for the Vets' Employment and Training Service...

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: One of the bills provides $1.68b for the agencies and offices responsible for managing our nation's public lands and protecting our natural heritage for future generations to enjoy.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Importantly, this bill also funds the Environmental Protection Agency at $9.06b. This money provides hundreds of millions of dollars for important conservation and climate change mitigation work around the country.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It also provides $502m for the National Wildlife Refuge System and $68m for State and Tribal Wildlife Grants and it funds the National Park Service at $3.38 billion, to preserve and manage the natural wonders that dot our nation.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $495m is set aside for the Land and Water Conservation Fund, which finances projects to protect natural areas and water resources around the country.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: These funding bills included money for important environment and conservation programs, too. One of the bills increases funding for NOAA's Climate Research programs to $170m and its Nat'l Ocean Service to $599m. This money finances government climate change mitigation projects.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The package also funds the Department of Energy at $38.5b, with $2.79b going to the office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy, and $425m for the Advanced Research Projects Agency - Energy (ARPA-E). These are the offices whose research yields breakthrough in clean energy.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: ...with $242m for its Wage and Hour Division, $582m for OSHA, and $106m for the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs - the federal offices that make sure workers are treated well and paid fairly.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Ensuring companies meet mandated labor standards is another important priority which is why I voted in favor of providing $12.4 billion for the Department of Labor...

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In these bills we made it clear that education must be a priority.  Important programs such as Title I, Special Education, Head Start, Preschool Development Grants, Financial Assistance programs, and more all saw their funding levels increase over previous levels.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Education is another area where our investments have long lasting impacts that can benefit, or hinder, our progress as a society.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In order to ensure that our democratic institutions are operating fairly and efficiently we must have a comprehensive and accurate census. The $7.56 billion for the Census Bureau included in the funding package will help us carry out the 2020 Census.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We also secured $425 million for election security grants to protect the integrity of our elections, a priority that Republicans didn‚Äôt fund when they were in control of the House.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Included in those funding bills was $25 million for gun violence research at the CDC and NIH, this is the first time money has been dedicated to this desperately needed research in more than 20 years.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Earlier this week, the House passed 2 funding packages that averted another painful holiday shutdown. While the packages were not perfect, they funded vital programs that will help Americans across the country and include landmark funding for essential initiatives.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I will continue my work to support legislative efforts to make the United States a global climate leader.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We have the resources and the capacity to be global leaders on this issue and we have a responsibility to future generations to be good stewards of the world they will inherit.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Addressing global climate change will be difficult, but it is a challenge that our country must not hesitate to tackle.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: A letter requesting robust funding for the Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs Science and Technology Global Change Research program; and a letter requesting $154 million for the DOE‚Äôs Fuel Cell Technologies Office and $50 million for DOE‚Äôs Solid Oxide Fuel Cell programs.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Additionally, I signed on to appropriations requests aimed at conservation efforts around the country. I joined a letter requesting $3.576 million for the National Park Service‚Äôs Partnership Wild and Scenic Rivers program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This legislation helps coastal communities prepare for extreme weather by directing the National Science Foundation and the National Institute for Standards and Technology to fund research into infrastructure improvements that account for extreme weather.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Furthermore, I am a cosponsor of H.R. 1317, the Coastal Communities Adaptation Act, introduced by Rep. Harley Rouda (D-CA).

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I also signed on to a letter requesting $1.46 billion in funding for the Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs Hazardous Substance Superfund Account.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I led a letter to the House Appropriations Committee requesting an increase in funds for the Department of Energy‚Äôs (DOE) Clean Cities Coalition program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Congress has a responsibility to assist states and communities that want to protect themselves against climate change. That is why I supported efforts to finance climate change priorities in the yearly government appropriations process.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: And H.R. 1429 provides $7.5 billion in federal grants for states and local governments that need assistance funding water infrastructure projects.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Both bills invest in our nation‚Äôs water infrastructure and its efficiency projects ‚Äì H.R. 1162 provides $500 million for a federal competitive grant program that provides funding for projects that focus on water recycling technology.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Other bills I have cosponsored are H.R. 1162, the Water Recycling Investment and Improvement Act introduced by Rep. Grace Napolitano (D-CA) and H.R. 1429, the Drinking Water Infrastructure for Job Creation Act introduced by Rep. Maxine Waters (D-CA).

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I am also a cosponsor of H.R. 4965, the LEARNS Act, introduced by Rep. Mark Pocan (D-WI), which expands the number of registered apprenticeships available for workers who can be paid living wages during their training, and who are given opportunities for upward job mobility.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This resolution asserts that our country needs to embrace clean energy jobs, modernize our aging energy grid, prioritize energy efficiency in our infrastructure projects.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I am a cosponsor of H.Con.Res.36, Supporting Efforts to Enact a Bold Jobs and Infrastructure Package that Benefits All Americans, Not Just Billionaires, introduced by Rep. Ted Lieu (D-CA).

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This bill provides $7.5 billion in funding for investments in transportation infrastructure projects through the Better Utilizing Investments to Leverage Development (BUILD) grant program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Our country needs to create green infrastructure and shift our energy sector‚Äôs workforce towards jobs that build and maintain that infrastructure. That is why I am a cosponsor of legislation like H.R 1428, the Transportation Infrastructure for Job Creation Act.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R. 9 passed the House of Representatives on May 2, 2019 by a vote of 231 to 190 and is currently awaiting review in the Senate.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This commonsense bill requires the United States to remain in the Paris Climate Accords and requires government agencies to set and achieve greenhouse gas emissions reduction goals.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We must reengage in the Paris Climate Accords, as the most powerful economy in the world, the United States has a responsibility to be a part of this international effort. That is why I voted in favor of H.R. 9, the Climate Action Now Act.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Mitigating the impacts of climate change must be a worldwide priority. I take this priority seriously and have supported legislative efforts to place our country at the forefront of the fight against climate change.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Throughout the day, I will be sharing some of my efforts in Congress to combat climate change.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Climate change is a real and urgent issue whose impacts are being felt around our country and around the world. Unusually dry summers, rising ocean temperatures, and melting ice caps are all threatening communities.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I call on my colleagues to come together and swiftly take up these crucial measures. Congress can act now, with the support of the country, to end the national nightmare of gun violence.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: 60% of Americans support an assault weapons ban. I am a cosponsor of H.R. 1296, the Assault Weapons Ban of 2019, which would criminalize the sale or possession of any semiautomatic assault weapon or large capacity ammunition feeding device.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I am a cosponsor of H.R. 1236, the Extreme Risk Protection Order Act of 2019, which would incentivize and meaningfully fund efforts to install red flag protections nationwide. This bill respects local jurisdictions and encourages best practices.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: 80% of Americans support a ‚Äúred flag‚Äù law, which allows state courts to temporarily confiscate firearms from a person deemed a danger to themselves and others by family or law enforcement.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Any handgun owner would have to be at least 21 years old, undergo safety training, pass a background check, and renew their license every five years.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: 82% of Americans support a licensing system for gun purchases. I am an original cosponsor of H.R. 687, the Handgun Licensing & Registration Act of 2019, which establishes a national licensing system.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R. 8 passed the House on February 27, 2019 by a vote of 240-190 and now awaits Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to bring it to the Senate floor for a vote.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: 93% of Americans support universal background checks. I am a cosponsor of #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019, which would require a background check for every sale, possession, or transfer of a firearm in the U.S.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: A recent Quinnipiac University poll found overwhelming, bipartisan support nationwide for commonsense gun reform. The good news is legislation exists right now in Washington to transform these popular ideas into law.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Space exploration and the technological innovation that enables it has transformed the way we live our lives on a daily basis. For more information on these developments and other NASA Spinoff technologies, visit: https://t.co/nUG0Wi82KF

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Additionally, NASA developed a special coating designed to protect equipment and helmet visors in space that are now used for scratch-resistant lenses.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA If you have ever worn invisible braces, the first version of these were created using a transparent ceramic that was initially developed by NASA.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Land mine removal is made possible by a NASA partnership that utilizes surplus rocket fuel to destroy land mines without detonation.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Have you ever slept on a memory foam mattress? Memory foam evolved from a 1970s NASA funded research project looking to improve the seats of pilots & eventually was installed on space shuttles.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Walking down the street, you can spot almost everyone using hands free devices. Wireless headsets were one of the communications technologies developed by NASA to give astronauts more freedom without the inconvenience of chords.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Dustbusters are a common product in many households. Besides quickly cleaning up messes, this technology developed from an earlier Black & Decker tech used by NASA during the Apollo & Gemini missions to collect lunar samples via portable drill.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: @NASA Have you ever wondered how your cell phone camera got to be so small? The technology for many of our cell phone cameras was engineered by NASA, trying to create cameras small enough to fit on spacecraft.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Did you know that @NASA technology impacts our daily lives right here on Earth? For this #FridayFocus, I will feature some facts of the space-related tech we use every day that highlights the need for continued investment in scientific research & the value of space exploration.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Tomorrow, America will celebrate the 50th Anniversary of Apollo 11‚Äôs lunar landing. It is amazing to consider all the scientific advancements that enabled us to put a man on the moon.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I will continue to fight for New Jersey and programs that impact the 8th District as the Senate considers these bills and the appropriations process progresses.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Small Business Administration (SBA) was funded at $280 million, including money for Women‚Äôs Business Centers, Microloan Technical Assistance, and Small Business Development Center.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $300 million was provided for Community Development Financial Institutions, which provides targeted resources and innovate programs to connect public and private investments in mission-driven financial institutions.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Included was $600 million for Election Security Grants to fortify the integrity of our federal elections, along with $16.2 million for the Election Assistance Commission to continue to innovate security procedures and technology.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Finally, the House passed H.R. 3351, a bill to provide funding for the Department of the Treasury, the Judiciary, the Executive Office of the President, and other independent agencies such as the Small Business Administration. H.R. 3351 passed by a vote of 224 to 196.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Additionally, this bill increased funding for historic programs that have continued to support vulnerable Americans facing adverse living situations, including $410 million for Housing Opportunities for People with AIDS and $40 million for the Section 4 Capacity Building program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Critically, H.R. 3055 blocked the Trump Administration‚Äôs public housing rule change on families of mixed immigration status, which would have threatened the livelihood of 55,000 children who are citizens or legal residents.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This bill also included $2.9 billion for the Public Housing Capital Fund $4.8 billion & for the Public Housing Operating Fund to help public housing agencies in local communities preserve and modernize existing housing units, while beginning to develop and construct new units.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $1.75 billion for the HOME Investment Partnership Program, which keeps low-income families on the verge of homelessness in stable housing and helps them on the path to homeownership ‚Äì $500 million above the 2019 enacted level.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $300 million for the Choice Neighborhoods Initiative, which leverages both private and public funding for community coalitions to restore distressed housing in vulnerable communities ‚Äì $150 million above the 2019 enacted level.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: $3.6 billion for Community Development Block Grants (CDBG), which thousands of cities and towns rely on for the improvement of their neighborhoods ‚Äì $300 million above the 2019 enacted level.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The House appropriations bill not only rejected this request and kept these programs, but increased funding for many of them compared to last year‚Äôs enacted levels.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: President Trump‚Äôs budget cruelly requested the complete elimination of critical programs like Community Development Block Grants, Choice Neighborhoods Initiative, and HOME Investment Partnership Program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The House also voted to fund $50.1 billion for the Department of Housing and Urban Development, $5.9 billion above the previous year‚Äôs budget and $13.4 billion above the President‚Äôs request.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In total, the Department of Transportation was funded at $86.6 billion ‚Äì $3.7 billion more than what the President asked for ‚Äì to do its work of administering our country‚Äôs transportation networks.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: And, thanks to a letter I led in April, the bill's report includes language reiterating that BUILD grants should be fairly awarded to public transportation and commuter rail projects. Over two years, BUILD grants awards have drifted away from these projects.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This might sound trivial, but Gateway Project opponents have been delaying it by insisting that it is too "reliant" on federal funding. The policy in this bill makes the point clear - NJ plans to pay the gov't back for its loans, so it should count as our share, not the govt's.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The bill also includes important policy that removes roadblocks from the Gateway Project. Thanks to an effort I led, the bill includes language clarifying that certain federal loans count as part of the project-share, if the loans are paid back with non-federal money.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The bill also raises funding for the Capital Investment Grants' New Starts program, which helps finance commuter rail rehabilitation projects, to nearly $1.5 billion. New Jersey can take advantage of the increase to upgrade our commuter rail network.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: DOT administers many grants programs which it awards on a competitive basis. This year's bill funds the BUILD grants program, which funds huge infrastructure projects like Gateway, at $1 billion. At that funding level, there's a better chance that Gateway gets the money it needs.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Thanks to the work done by myself and my colleagues, the Department of Transportation appropriations bill included funding for New Jersey's infrastructure priorities including public transportation rehabilitation and the Gateway Project.

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Energy and Water appropriations bill included $46.4 billion for agencies and programs that spur energy innovation, combat global climate change, and improve our nation's water infrastructure.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Department of Labor is receiving $13.3 billion in funding this year to carry out the work it does on behalf of our nation‚Äôs workforce. This includes funding for workforce training, safety oversight, and labor protection enforcement.

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The bill also enhances resources for women‚Äôs health by increasing funding for programs that address maternal and child health, as well as a $114 million increase for the Title X Family Planning program and the 4 million people who depend on it.

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I want to thank you for taking the time to read today‚Äôs #FridayFocus on an extremely important topic.  If you have any questions or want more information on immigration legislation or data, please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to my office.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Debate on immigration policy frequently becomes heated but I ask that you keep the information I shared today in mind.  Our country has provided countless immigrants with an opportunity for a better life and our communities have benefited as a result.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R. 6 passed in the House of Representatives earlier this month and has not yet been scheduled for a vote in the Senate.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R. 6 doesn‚Äôt allow any of these people to ‚Äúcut the line‚Äù and receive their citizenship on some sort of fast track, the process would take years. It simply rectifies a horrible mistake within our broken immigration system that left so many people in an uncertain state.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Jersey City is the home of 3,800 H.R. 6 protected immigrants, on avg the Dreamers arrived when they were 9 years old & the avg TPS recipient has been in here since 1995. These immigrants pay $48.6 million in Federal taxes and $23.7 million in State & local taxes each year.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Newark is home to 4,900 H.R. 6 protected immigrants.  On average the Dreamers arrived when they were 9 and most TPS recipients came to Newark in 2000. They pay $22.2 million in Federal taxes and $15.2 million in State and local taxes every year.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Elizabeth is home to 5,400 H.R. 6 protected immigrants, on average the Dreamers arrived at the age of 9 and TPS recipients came in 1997. These 5,400 people pay $35.4 million in Federal taxes and $21.3 million in State and local taxes every year.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Out of all the members on the House Budget Committee, I represent the district with the most individuals (19,500) covered by these programs and we would be severely impacted if the protections were removed.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This is why I am proud to be an original cosponsor of H.R. 6, the American Dream and Promise Act of 2019. This legislation would help to create a pathway to legal permanent resident status for Dreamers and TPS recipients.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: We can argue about what immigration reform should look like, but we can‚Äôt deny that there are good people who would get ‚Äúin line‚Äù if there was a line for them at all and that our immigration system has failed them.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Both groups contribute to our economy, work hard to improve their communities, and are Americans in their hearts.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Within our flourishing immigrant population, there is a subset that faces even more obstacles, Dreamers & TPS recipients.  Dreamers were brought to this country as kids & only know America as home while some TPS recipients have been here for decades after fleeing violence & chaos

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: These tax dollars fund infrastructure improvements, better school systems, Social Security, and countless other initiatives.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Beyond creating jobs, immigrants in the 8th District pay over $3.3 billion in taxes every year. This money goes to fund programs that positively impact our communities, and millions of Americans across the country.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: If you walk down the street, chances are you‚Äôll pass at least one business that was created by an immigrant or pass a neighbor who works at one.  The 8th District is home to nearly 12,000 of immigrant entrepreneurs.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Despite being less than 14% of the total population, immigrants make up about 30% of all new entrepreneurs.  We see the hard work of these entrepreneurs every day in the 8th District.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Stabilizing populations allow communities to attract businesses, create jobs, employ individuals and boost local government revenues - allowing everyone to benefit from increased investment.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In fact, the working-age population is only expected to grow by .3 percent each year for the next decade but immigrants will make up 85% of that growth.  This growth also prevents population decline in rural areas, which helps stabilize local populations.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This leads to lower productivity, an erosion of business dynamism, and a general decrease to our economic growth. Immigrants help make up for this shortfall of workers when they join the workforce.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Beyond the links between immigration and lower crime rates, immigration helps make our nation more productive.  Our workforce is aging and as baby boomers retire and birth rates fall, our working-age population shrinks.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: According to one study by the @NewAmericanEcon , 9 out of the 10 American cities that received the largest influx of refugees between 2006 and 2015 saw violent crime rates drop over this same period. https://t.co/mYZHnp1B7u

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: As I said on Wednesday, I just don‚Äôt buy the claim that immigrants are criminals and the facts back me up.  On average, cities with substantial immigrant populations have lower crime rates than those with small immigrant populations.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The President chooses to characterize immigrants as criminals ‚Äì a threat to our society, but as an immigrant myself, I know this is not the case. Immigrants are hard-working and patriotic contributors to our economy.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: They are your neighbors, classmates, colleagues, and family members. Unfortunately, the Trump administration wants to stop immigrants from coming into the country.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The 8th District of New Jersey is a perfect example of how immigrants enrich our culture and contribute to our economy every day. Our district is home to over 330,000 immigrants who make up nearly 44% of our population.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The United States has always been a country that welcomes immigrants and gives them the opportunity to make a difference for their families, communities, and the country they have chosen to call home.

name: Albio Sires

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Thank you for joining me for this week‚Äôs #FridayFocus discussing the realities of poverty in America. Congress must continue to help those in need.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Living in, or at the edges of, poverty is a reality for many Americans and I am dedicated to fighting for programs that help those in need. No one in the 8th District or across the country should have to worry about food and shelter.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Child Care and Development Block Grant helps fund services and programs that prepare children for success in school. In New Jersey there are almost 30,000 families enrolled in the program.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: CHIP, the Children‚Äôs Health Insurance Program, along with Medicaid, provides health coverage to millions of children across the country, and SSI, Supplemental Security Income, helps provide funds to seniors who are unable to work.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) offers nutrition assistance to about 43 million families each year, and kept 8.4 million people out of poverty, in 2015 alone. In New Jersey that year there were over 900,000 people receiving benefits.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: During the ongoing appropriations process I signed letters requesting funding for these programs, among others. Because I know the real impact they can make on people‚Äôs everyday lives.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I have been, and remain, a vigilant supporter of programs such as SNAP, CHIP, SSI, and the Child Care & Development Block Grant.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Furthermore, the Administration also wants to impose harsher work requirements for people who seek benefits. This would lower the amount of people eligible for benefits and is a cruel form of discrimination against those who are disabled and unable to work.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The White House also wants to implement an $8.6 billion spending cut to the Department of Housing and Urban Development. This would decrease available funds for grants and programs that help people afford housing.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: If the Administration does change the measurement data, 300,000 children and 150,000 seniors would lose their health coverage from Medicaid. This is without the President‚Äôs proposed $1.5 trillion cut from Medicaid, which would cause even more people to lose their health coverage.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The current measurement of poverty in the U.S. uses the Consumer Price Index but this Administration wants to switch to an alternative measure of inflation that would decrease the amount of people eligible for certain programs such as Medicaid and SNAP.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In 2017, the 8th District had a poverty rate of 15.5%, and 22.5% of children were living in poverty. However, the Trump Administration wants to build more barriers and make it more difficult for families and individuals to sign up for and receive benefits.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Therefore, there are millions more Americans who are struggling to make ends meet but are not categorized as under the poverty line, meaning they cannot receive benefits from the federal government, which in turn, punishes them financially.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This number does not consider the current reality for a family that may be enduring hardships but doesn‚Äôt fall below the official poverty line. The National Center for Children in Poverty estimates a family requires an income of twice the poverty level to support their needs.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Unfortunately, almost 40 million Americans, about 12% of the population, fall below the poverty line. Even more frustrating is the realization that nearly 1 in 5 children under the age of 18 live in poverty.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: In the 116th Congress, my colleagues and I have made it our highest priority to pass legislation that improves daily life for all Americans. Helping working families become financially secure and providing them with extra resources is one part of this mission.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Thank you for joining me for this #FridayFocus to discuss how the appropriations process works and the importance of the process to our democratic system.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The appropriations process is an important aspect of Congress‚Äôs Constitutional power of the purse. Funding levels determined during the appropriations process are crucial to the performance of agencies and implementation of public programs.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Upon both chambers adopting an identical spending bill, the bill is then sent to the President for his signature or veto.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Both chambers must pass an identical bill before it can be signed into law. If there are differences the chambers can then continue to pass amendments to each other until issues are resolved or can hold a conference of members in order to get an agreement.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Once the spending bill passes the House, it is sent to the Senate for consideration. The Senate can also make changes to the bill in the form of amendments. These amendments usually become the topic of debate between the two chambers.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: When a minibus like this comes to the House Floor members are given the chance to offer amendments and change funding levels of the bill before it receives a vote.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The debate this week centered on a minibus, a package of 4 smaller appropriations bills. This minibus, H.R. 2740, considered spending limits for Labor, Health and Human Services, Education, Defense, State and Foreign Operations, and Energy and Water Development.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Following passage in the Appropriations Committee the spending bills will be brought to the House floor for a vote. The spending packages can be voted on individually, all-together, or in smaller groupings known as a ‚Äúminibus‚Äù.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Each subcommittee will then mark up their spending proposal before sending it to the full committee for consideration.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Next, each subcommittee will create a budget that allocates their total predetermined funding to the programs and agencies under their jurisdiction. This power of Congress to determine spending levels is vital for enforcing checks and balances.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Some of the letters I signed supported funding for medical research, affordable housing programs, community health centers, community development grants, law enforcement grants, and gun violence prevention measures.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Once these letters are circulated, members formally submit their funding priorities to the 12 subcommittees.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The appropriations process begins in the House, it is important the proposed funding levels reflect the needs of constituents, not just the White House‚Äôs desired budget.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Members lead & sign onto letters to the Appropriations Committee outlining requests important to their district.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The appropriations process began a few months ago. After reviewing the President‚Äôs proposed budget, Members of Congress have an opportunity to submit funding requests to support various programs, agencies, and priorities.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This week, the House of Representatives started debating amendments on our first appropriations package for FY 2020. For this week‚Äôs #FridayFocus let‚Äôs take a deeper look into how the appropriations process works.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: This is just the beginning of the work left to do in Congress. Life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness includes a person‚Äôs inherent ability to choose how they identify and who they love.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: The fight for LGBTQ+ protections also extends beyond our borders. I have joined my colleagues in sending letters to the Secretary of State Mike Pompeo bringing to his attention LGBTQ+ abuses by the governments of Chechnya and Brazil and demanding quick action.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I cosponsored H.R. 2775, which would add gender and sexual identity protections to the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act and create queer inclusive reporting standards for the Department of Health and Human Services.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R 2775, the Protecting LGBTQ+ Youth Act, addresses the increased risks of abuse and negligence queer youth face in unwelcoming homes

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: As a cosponsor, I am outraged that any American could be denied a home because of hate.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R. 2402, the Fair and Equal Housing Act, is a standalone provision of the Equality Act that would ensure no person is turned away from housing because of bigotry against sexual orientation and gender identity.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: It is time now for the Senate to take up H.R. 5 and enact these landmark federal protections into law.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: H.R. 5 is a comprehensive federal package that would forbid discrimination in housing, services, and employment on the basis of sexual and gender identity. As an original cosponsor, I proudly voted for its passage.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Last month‚Äôs historic House passage of H.R. 5, the Equality Act, demonstrates the political support for legislation enshrining equal protection under the law for LGBTQ+ Americans.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: I thank all of those who put the needs of others before their own 75 years ago, and remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice in the face of such a harrowing challenge .

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Few moments hold such historic significance, that in one of history‚Äôs darkest hours, millions of young men and women chose to unite and rebuild a free world is a remarkable achievement.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: Their unthinkable sacrifice, dedication to country and fellow soldiers, and commitment to upholding freedom and democracy helped them to topple the Nazi regime.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: These brave soldiers took up this task in the name of freedom, to fight for the values and ideals they cherished against the dimming force of oppression and authoritarianism. Today I remember and thank those soldiers who stormed the beaches during D-Day.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: American, British, Canadian, French, and soldiers of many other nationalities stormed Utah, Omaha, Gold, Juno, and Sword beaches in France despite fierce German resistance.

name: Albio Sires
tweet_text: 75 years ago today, thousands of courageous young men embarked on an invasion of Normandy, France, while thousands more dropped in behind enemy lines.
